headline.main: FULL RETRAIT' IS ON; More Than 1,000 Nazis Taken Prisoner After Their Line Caves In

lead_paragraph: ALGIERS, Dec. 2 -- A week after crossing the Sangro River, Gen. Sir Bernard L. Montgomery's Allied Eighth Army has smashed the main German defense line near the Adriatic, captured Rocca San Giovanni, is hammering at the outskirts of Casoli and Castelfrentano and has the German Army in "full retreat," according to a special communique issued by Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower today.
abstract: Montgomery forces attacks cause full Ger retreat; Rocca San Giovanni captured; many prisoners reptd taken; Gers attempt to reinforce line by drawing troops from northern Italy; 8th Army troops reptd near best road to Rome; rains hamper pursuit of Gers; 5th Army drive in western area reptd; close Allied aerial support reptd; US 34th Div formerly headed by Maj Gen Ryder reptd to have joined Clark forces
